title: Nocturnals: Cacti Coast Announcement
summary: We're excited to announce the next game in the Nocturnals series!
body:
After months of development, we're thrilled to reveal Nocturnals: Cacti Coast, the highly anticipated sequel to our beloved indie adventure game.

This new installment takes players to the sun-baked deserts of Cacti Coast, where new mysteries await and familiar characters return with enhanced abilities and deeper storylines.

Key features include:

  • Expanded world with 3 new biomes
  • Online multiplayer for up to 6 players
  • Enhanced character customization
  • New storyline featuring beloved characters

Wishlist now on Steam to be notified when the game launches!

title: 40% Off for LudoNarraCon
summary: We're happy to announce that Nocturnals is on sale May 1st - 5th as part of LudoNarraCon!
body:
We're excited to participate in LudoNarraCon 2025, the premier celebration of narrative-driven games!

From May 1st through May 5th, you can grab Nocturnals at a massive 40% discount on Steam. This is the perfect opportunity to experience our story-rich adventure if you haven't already.

LudoNarraCon showcases games that push the boundaries of interactive storytelling, and we're honored to be included alongside so many incredible titles.

Don't miss out on this limited-time offer - the sale ends May 5th at 11:59 PM PST!

title: Our support for Stop Killing Games
summary: We express our support for the Stop Killing Games campaign in the UK.
body:
As developers who care deeply about game preservation and player rights, Cowboy Toad Games officially supports the Stop Killing Games campaign.

This important initiative aims to prevent publishers from making games completely unplayable after support ends. We believe that when players purchase a game, they should have reasonable assurance that their purchase will remain functional.

Our commitment:

  • All our games are designed to work offline
  • We avoid always-online DRM that could break functionality
  • If we ever discontinue a service, we'll provide transition plans

We encourage other developers to consider the long-term impact of their technical decisions on game preservation.

Learn more about the Stop Killing Games campaign
